intro: Noccaea yunnanensis, commonly known as Yunnan Noccaea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to China, particularly the Yunnan Province, and thrives in mountainous regions with cool, moist climates. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It has a hairy texture on its stems and leaves, which helps protect it from harsh environmental conditions. Noccaea yunnanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
